item.title: Get a ride and offset your carbon emissions
item.description:
Grab users will soon have the option to lessen the environmental impact of their trips by utilizing a new carbon offset feature integrated into the Grab app. Source: Grab. Explaining the carbon offset feature. A recent study across six Southeast Asian countries revealed that 82% of Grab users are concerned about climate change and are taking steps to minimize their environmental impact. However, 44% of those concerned but not actively addressing it cited a lack of knowledge on how to act, while 31% found it too challenging...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/get-a-ride-and-offset-your-carbon-emissions/

item.title: Dubai's RTA has entered into a partnership with Careem for ride-hailing services
item.description:
Source: RTA. HE Mattar Al Tayer, Director-General and Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of RTA and Mudassir Sheikha, Founder and Managing Director of Careem, signed the agreement on behalf of the two respective entities. RTA executives attending the signing included Mohammed Obaid Al Mulla, Member of Board of Executive Directors, Abdullah Yousef Al Ali, CEO of Public Transport Agency, and Adel Shakri, Director of Transportation Systems. Bassel Al Nahlaoui, VP of Business Development & Government Relations attended on behalf of Careem...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/dubai-s-rta-has-entered-into-a-partnership-with-careem-for-ride-hailing-services/

item.title: Uber has expanded its services to Seremban, Malaysia
item.description:
Source: Uber. UberX is arriving in Seremban in December Uber is expanding its services to Seremban, the eighth city in Malaysia to have Uber. Starting December 1, 2016, residents of Seremban can hail a ride via the UberX service. This launch comes after the successful introduction of UberX in Melaka on October 27, 2016. Uber also presents earning opportunities for driver-partners using their own vehicles. Drivers have the flexibility to set their own schedules and determine their earnings...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/uber-has-expanded-its-services-to-seremban-malaysia/

item.title: Members of Emirates Skywards can enjoy Careem services
item.description:
Source: Careem website. Emirates Skywards partners with Careem to provide benefits for their members. Emirates Skywards, the loyalty program for Emirates, has partnered with Careem. This makes Emirates Skywards the only frequent flyer program to provide both earning and redemption opportunities with the leading car booking app in the region. Careem is a rapidly growing company, currently operating in nine countries. Members can earn and redeem Skywards Miles when using Careem services in the UAE, Qatar, KSA, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Pakistan, Kuwait, and Morocco...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/members-of-emirates-skywards-can-enjoy-careem-services/

item.title: Grab for Work assists businesses in managing transportation costs
item.description:
Grab, a Southeast Asian ride-hailing company, has introduced Grab for Work, a complimentary transport expense management tool for businesses in Southeast Asia. Designed for business leaders, managers, HR, and finance professionals in both SMEs and MNCs, Grab for Work provides a streamlined approach to handling company transportation costs. Developed with feedback from over 150 companies in the region during its beta phase, Grab for Work is currently utilized by a similar number of businesses across Southeast Asia, including notable names such as Chope Group (Singapore), Park Hotel Group (Singapore), Rainmaker Labs (Singapore), Yesboss (Indonesia), and Malaysian Airlines (Malaysia)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/grab-for-work-assists-businesses-in-managing-transportation-costs/
